overview: A hermit looks at a large book in the forest and repeatedly immerses himself in the visual world of Hieronymus Bosch. After he has had a vision of the Resurrection of Christ, he takes wing to the present day. As a factory director he immerses himself in the world of machines. We experience the factory and meet his family. As he brings his daughter to the airport, a bird flies across the sky. This completes the narrative arc begun as the hermit gazes at birds in flight at the beginning of the story.
title: Hieronymus
